newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: CHIPITA, MATUTANO FACTORY TO EXPORT CROISSANTS.
newsitem.headline: CHIPITA, MATUTANO FACTORY TO EXPORT CROISSANTS.

text.p: A joint venture between Matutano, a unit of PepsiCo Foods International and Greece's Chipita International SA plans to export initially 15 percent and later up to 50 percent of the packaged croissants produced at its new factory in Portugal.

"The main markets will be Spain and Morocco, but we also expect the Netherlands, Belgium and France to take our output," the president of the Chipita joint venture, Jose Manuel Carvalho, said at the opening of the factory.
The 800 million escudo factory, based in Alenquer north of Lisbon, will produce about 3,000 tonnes of croissants a year.

The two companies expect the factory to generate sales worth 3.0 billion escudos a year. Matutano will hold 60 percent of the capital and Chipita the remaining 40 percent. --Alcina Monteiro, Lisbon newsroom +351-1-3538254
